business.headline: 90-hour workweek: What India Inc thinks of L&T chief's suggestionL&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan recently expressed regret over not being able to make employees work on Sundays, suggesting that a 90-hour workweek is key to success.

Will the stock market recover next week? 4 things you should knowGlobal headwinds and FII outflows weigh on the Sensex and Nifty. Will Dalal Street see a recovery next week after the turbulent run?

Explained: Why Infosys has filed counter lawsuit against CognizantInfosys vs Cognizant legal battle: The Bengaluru-based firm accused its US-based rival of contractually restricting clients from awarding IT services to competitors and withholding software training, which Infosys claims hindered its ability to compete.
High-return FD offers in 2025: SBI, IDBI, Indian Bank, and moreEnhance your savings in 2025 with FD schemes offering up to 8.05% interest, valid until March 31, 2025.

Supreme Court gives big relief for online gaming sector. Details hereThe Supreme Court has stayed Rs 1.12 lakh crore GST notices against online gaming firms, with a final hearing scheduled for March 18, 2025.

Industry leaders call for up to 90-hour workweek. Are they willing to pay more? L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan made waves by suggesting employees should work on Sundays. Last year, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy proposed that millennials work 70-hour weeks to improve India's productivity.
Budget 2025: Don't expect these tax changesBudget 2025 is likely to prioritise fiscal discipline, minor tax tweaks, and cautious consumption boosts over bold reforms.

Rupee hits all-time low, nears 86 mark against US dollarRupee hits all-time: Closing at 85.9650, the rupee marked its tenth consecutive weekly loss, slipping 0.2% this week amid a strong dollar and persistent capital outflows.
Sensex, Nifty close lower amid earnings concerns; TCS gains 6% The S&P BSE Sensex lost 241.30 points to end at 77,378.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 95 points to end at 23,431.50.

Explained: Why IRCTC share price jumped up to 5% todayIRCTC share price: The stock rose nearly 5% to hit a day's high of Rs 800.65 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), compared to the previous close of Rs 763.50.
Blinkit launches Bistro app for 10-minute food deliveryBlinkit's Bistro delivers canteen-style food in 10 minutes, rivalling Swiggy's Snacc and Zepto Cafe.

Paytm sees strong institutional growth: Mutual fund stake surges by 3.3%, total holdings up 4%Paytm's progress toward achieving EBITDA before ESOP breakeven by Q4 FY2025 further reinforces its strong fundamentals and appeal to institutional investors.

Budget 2025: Looking back at tax relief measures for senior citizens in 2024Senior citizens seek tax relief and reforms in Budget 2025 to tackle inflation, income challenges and enhance their qulity of life.
GST return filing delayed. Deadline extension expectedGST return filing faces delays due to GSTN portal glitches, with a potential deadline extension expected to ease compliance challenges.

L&T chairman earned 534.57 times median salary of peers in FY24. Check detailsLarsen & Toubro (L&T) Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's remarks on the 90-hour workweek have been a topic of debate. Amid all this, his salary for FY24 has attracted eyeballs, which is 534.57 times the median salary of peers.
How to link and use your credit card for UPI transactions. A simple guideUPI integration with credit cards simplifies payments offering instant, secure, and contactless transactions.

Sensex, Nifty in volatile territory: What should stock market investors do? Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty rebounded on IT gains, but volatility persists amid FII outflows and global uncertainty. Here's what's driving the market and how investors should tackle it.

Budget 2025: What is joint taxation for married couples?The ICAI's Budget 2025 proposal for joint taxation of married couples aims to ease financial stress, boost compliance, and modernise India's tax system with higher exemptions and flexible slabs.

Tata Elxsi share price down 8%. Why did it hit 52-week low after Q3 results?Tata Elxsi stock price: At 10:40 a.m., Tata Elxsi's share price was down 7% at Rs 5992.95. In early trade, the stock hit a 52-week low of Rs 5,924.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Isro SpaDeX docking: Satellites moved back after trial attemptISRO's Space Docking Experiment (SpaDeX) satellites, SDX01 (Chaser) and SDX02 (Target), are now 15 metres apart in orbit, down from 230 metres on Saturday, the space agency announced.

Los Angeles wildfire toll rises to 13 as flames spread, more areas at riskAt least 13 people have been killed and more than 12,000 structures destroyed as powerful winds have fanned wildfires into destructive infernos across Los Angeles, authorities said Sunday.

Kapil Mishra, Abhay Verma named in BJP's second list for Delhi pollsBJP has released its second list of 29 candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, naming Kapil Mishra, a former AAP leader known for his hardline Hindutva politics, as its contender from Karawal Nagar seat.

IND vs ENG: Mohammed Shami returns, no place for Rishabh Pant in T20I squadMohammed Shami has returned to the Indian team for the first time since 2023 as he was added to the squad for the upcoming T20I series against England. India decided to leave out Rishabh Pant from the squad as Dhruv Jurel was added as the backup wicketkeeper behind Sanju Samson.

Los Angeles is burning and MAGA supporters blame diversity policies for infernoAs wildfires devastate Los Angeles, some conservatives, including Donald Trump and Elon Musk, blame DEI initiatives for firefighting and environmental policies.

School principal forces girls to remove shirts, sends them home in blazersA school principal, angered over students celebrating Pen Day, allegedly forced girls to remove their shirts and go home only wearing blazers.

Prashant Kishor gets notice for 'baseless' allegations against exam bodyThe Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) issued legal notices to Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor and YouTuber Khan Sir over comments on alleged irregularities in the Combined Competitive Examination. Both were asked to provide evidence or face legal action.

Loved aerial pics, videos: PM responds to Omar Abdullah's post on Sonamarg tunnelPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his enthusiasm for his visit to Jammu and Kashmir's Sonamarg to inaugurate the crucial Z-Morh Tunnel on January 13.

Love staring at my wife: Anand Mahindra's cheeky reply to 90-hour work week debateMahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra weighed in on the controversy over L&T chief SN Subrahmanyan's 90-hour work week remark and made a cheeky response that he loved staring at his "wonderful" wife.

Pierre Poilievre on Musk's endorsement: Open Tesla factories in Canada Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre responded to Elon Musk's endorsement by advocating for Tesla factories in Canada to boost jobs and investment. He criticised Trudeau's economic policies, highlighting voter fatigue after nine years of Liberal rule.

Law student at friend's flat in Noida falls from 7th floor, diesA law student, Tapas, died after allegedly falling from the seventh floor of a Noida apartment building while with friends. Police are investigating the incident, awaiting a family complaint for further legal action.

Malala Yousafzai visits native Pakistan for education summit: Overwhelmed, happyMalala Yousafzai, an education activist, was shot by the Pakistani Taliban in 2012 when she was a schoolgirl and has returned to the country only a handful of times since.

Childhood, setbacks, Godhra train fire: All that PM spoke about on podcast debutPrime Minister Narendra Modi debuted on a podcast with Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath, discussing his leadership journey, vision for India's youth, and "nation first" philosophy. He shared insights on governance, technology, and embracing mistakes.

Chilly weekend for Delhi-NCR as rain, fog lower temperatureDense fog and rain delayed 45 trains in Delhi as the national capital continued to witness a chilly day and recorded a maximum temperature of 17 degrees Celsius.

Israel's Netanyahu sends Mossad director to Gaza ceasefire talks in QatarNetanyahu has insisted on destroying Hamas' ability to fight in Gaza. Hamas has insisted on a full Israeli troop withdrawal from the largely devastated territory.

Arvind Kejriwal's dig over BJP's Chief Minister face: Congrats Ramesh BidhuriAAP chief Arvind Kejriwal took a dig at BJP's Ramesh Bidhuri and "congratulated" him, as he claimed that the party would declare him as the chief ministerial candidate.

Watch: PV Sindhu and Venkata Datta Sai's badminton session with Kiren RijijuPV Sindhu and her husband, Venkata Datta Sai, played a friendly badminton match with former Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju in New Delhi. UAE blacklists 8 UK-based Muslim outfits that have free pass in BritainThe UK organisations blacklisted by the UAE, a Muslim nation, span industries from real estate to education and media firms.

Maharashtra minister sparks fresh row with EVM remark, NDA ally issues cautionMaharashtra minister Nitesh Rane courted controversy when he claimed that EVM was 'Every Vote against Mullah' at an event in Sangli. His remarks did not go down well with the Opposition and Union Minister Ramdas Athawale's party, an NDA ally, slamming him.

What the Indian passport can learn from Singapore's, the world's most powerfulOver the past eight years, Singapore has consistently ranked in the top two and has remained amongst the top ten for over two decades, according to data from the Henley Passport Index.

Indian Army ready with bold blueprint for defence 'Year of Reforms'Underpinning the future-proofing initiative are five focus areas: jointness, restructuring, modernisation and tech infusion, systems and processes, and HR management

Inmate serving life sentence for murder escapes from Sabarmati jail in AhmedabadAhmedabad Police have initiated a manhunt for Manuji Thakor, a prisoner serving a life sentence for murder, who escaped from Sabarmati Central Jail on January 10.

Chief Minister Biren Singh urges Naga leaders to help resolve Manipur crisis 
Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh urged Naga community leaders to take a proactive role in resolving the state's ongoing crisis. Speaking at a Naga community event in Senapati district, he called for collective efforts, emphasising reconciliation, protecting indigenous communities, and restoring peace under constitutional frameworks.

Naga Chaitanya-Sobhita Dhulipala enjoy quality time with friendsNaga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala, who got married in Hyderabad, made a rare public appearance with friends. On Saturday, Tollywood actor Sushanth shared a heartwarming picture from the gathering on social media, delighting fans.

Christopher Nolan's Interstellar to re-release in India in FebruaryChristopher Nolan's acclaimed film Interstellar is set to make a return to Indian cinemas. The re-release was postponed due to the release of Pushpa 2: The Rule.

This Is Us star Milo Ventimiglia, wife lose home to wildfires before baby's birthMilo Ventimiglia, known for playing Jack Pearson in This Is Us, revealed that his Malibu home was destroyed in the California wildfires. The incident occurred just as the actor was preparing to welcome his first child.

Ram Charan greets fans waiting outside his home after Game Changer releaseAfter the release of Game Changer, a large crowd of fans gathered outside Ram Charan's house. The actor stepped out to greet them and urged everyone to prioritise safety and exercise caution as they celebrated by bursting crackers.

Shakib Al Hasan fails bowling reassessment test, Champions Trophy place in doubtShakib Al Hasan's hopes of making it to the Champions Trophy squad was dealt a serious blow as the Bangladesh all-rounder failed the reassessment test in India to clear his bowling action. Shakib was given a ban by the ECB after being suspected of an illegal action during a county game.

PSG target Khvicha Kvaratskhelia has asked to leave Napoli: Antonio ConteNapoli manager Antonio Conte has revealed that star forward Khvicha Kvaratskhelia has asked to leave the club immediately. Khvicha played an instrumental role in helping Napoli win their first Serie A title in 33 years in 2022.

Axar Patel named vice captain for England T20Is amid Delhi Capitals speculationIndia all-rounder Axar Patel has been named the vice-captain of the Indian T20I side for the upcoming five-match series against England.

Neeraj Chopra-organised javelin event gets World Athletics president endorsementThe Neeraj Chopra-organised javelin event, set to be conducted in May this year, has got an endorsement from the World Athletics President Sebastian Coe. Tsitsipas has always called the Australian Open his 'home' grand slam due to the presence of the greek population in Melbourne and their support.

Pakistan make 7 changes for West Indies Tests after 2-0 loss vs South Africa Pakistan announced a 15-member squad for the two-match Test series against West Indies. The selection committee made seven changes to their squad from the last series.

Malaysia Open: Satwik-Chirag crash out in semifinals as Indian challenge endsIndia's challenge at the Malaysia Open 2025 came to an end on Saturday, January 11 as Satwiksairaj Ranbkireddy and Chirag Shetty crashed out of the competition in the semi-finals of the men's doubles. Satwik-Chirag lost to South Korea's Won Ho Kim and Seung Jae Seo.

Michael Vaughan and Harbhajan praise 'T20 opener' Steve Smith after BBL tonSteve Smith dazzled with an unbeaten 121 off 64 balls in the BBL, equalling the record for most centuries in the tournament. Praised by Michael Vaughan and Harbhajan Singh, Smith's adaptability as a T20 opener stole the spotlight.

Won't be surprised to see Virat and Rohit scoring runs again: England pacerEngland fast bowler Tymal Mills has backed star Indian batting duo Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to find form again ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Pakistan batter Saim Ayub's Champions Trophy availability to be known in a weekPakistan batter Saim Ayub's availability in the Champions Trophy will be known in a week as he continues his recovery from an ankle injury he suffered during the South Africa Test series. The Pakistan Cricket Board is hoping to have Ayub available for the India game on February 23.

Vijay Hazare Trophy: Abhishek Sharma fails in quarter-final ahead of England seriesIndia and Punjab batter Abhishek Sharma was dismissed cheaply during the quarter-final game of the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2024-25 against Maharashtra.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
